{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2991406,"name":"Jason Rubenstein","username":"jruben4","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jruben4/{size}/169941_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T12:59:26.054Z","cooked":"

Why is it that the current version of the WPILib extension in the VS Code marketplace is 2021.1.2? I’ve tried uninstalling it and reinstalling it, or asking WPIlib to look for it’s own updates and it’s not finding the 2022.1.1 version.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T12:59:26.054Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":96,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":518.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400179,"topic_slug":"vs-code-wpilib-extension-out-of-date","display_username":"Jason Rubenstein","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35676,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2202 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/vs-code-wpilib-extension-out-of-date/400179/1","custom_user_title":"2202 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2991410,"name":"Dalton Smith","username":"Daltz3","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/daltz3/{size}/145991_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T13:22:56.284Z","cooked":"

The WPILib extension is marketplace is unsupported and always has been. We only support VS Code as it is installed through the WPILib installer, you should not be using a seperate install of VS Code.

A bit of background. We actually only have the extension in the store so nobody else puts one up and potentially distributed malware or a bad package. We’re working on making this extension a “stub” so that teams obviously see this is the wrong way to do things.

Is an extension that just nags you that you shouldn’t be setting up this way considered benign malware?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T15:01:43.798Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":88,"readers_count":87,"score":32.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":400179,"topic_slug":"vs-code-wpilib-extension-out-of-date","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":29225,"username":"Daltz3","name":"Dalton Smith","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/daltz3/{size}/145991_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/vs-code-wpilib-extension-out-of-date/400179/3","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2991499,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T15:22:43.042Z","cooked":"

Nag is the wrong word. It would be an extension that only provides one function: an item in the WPILib menu that links you to the releases page. So not a very useful extension, but it does nothing malicious either.

Why would you design it this way?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2022-01-15T16:55:17.102Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":18.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400179,"topic_slug":"vs-code-wpilib-extension-out-of-date","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":29225,"username":"Daltz3","name":"Dalton Smith","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/daltz3/{size}/145991_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36692,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vs-code-wpilib-extension-out-of-date/400179/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2992205,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-15T17:20:17.457Z","cooked":"

There are several things which the standalone VS Code install does for improved stability and fewer team issues, including:

  • it’s configured to use our installed JDK
  • it doesn’t auto-update, so the extension won’t break mid-season

Having all the versions of things installed by a single installer makes it a lot more reliable than potentially having mismatches between different installations coming through different paths.
